Posts.Content: Thankyou that was lovely you take and do whatever it takes to get you through this we are here for you TC xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: Sunshine 19 I am 4 years post had masectomy chemo radio I remember that feeling so well of not wanting to eat the churning of stomach I finally spoke to my doc got prescribed antidepressant I call it my little majic pill what a difference just settles you may not be for everyone but the option is there don't struggle all the help is there for you TC x
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Title: 2019 Meet up in Scotland ? Anyone ?

Posts.Content: I enjoy aqua aerobics don't need to be a swimmer and the softie you get for your swimming Cossie is really good no one can tell diff when I have mine in lovely pics and weather really nice was really icy here this morning and so slippy xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Violetsniff had a good laugh at (I love you ) I seem to come out with a lot of silly things or words mixed up so good to hear I am not alone ha ha you made me think of trying the card making I have often thought of doing it sorry to hear you have had a rotten time onwards and upwards take care x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi alijmay so sorry to hear you have or may not have to go through this again I have found this forum fab you can always rely on us for support and most of the time someone will be I same position as you it is all about keeping that mind busy and one day at a time I also go to Maggie's every week for Thai chi and exercise great place to chat meet people hav a cuppa you take care stay strong xx
Posts.Title: Feeling nervous about gp appointment

Posts.Content: Ajimay are able to get out for a bit with someone phaps for coffee I remember only to well when I was same but switched of for a time when I got out won't be long now Al say wee prayer for you give yourself a talking to you can do it TC xx
Posts.Title: Feeling nervous about gp appointment

Posts.Content: Hi ruby rose that's shocking news hopefully you will be seen soon and get the reasurance you need I could only do 4 sessions and 2 were lowered as I was so sick Al be thinking of you keep us posted take care you have been doing so well xx
Posts.Title: NHS Tayside Breast cancer on BBC

Posts.Content: I am overweight never had a weight issue before my BC am at ww and aqua aerobics think key is to eat healthy and a little exercise every day finding something you enjoy also do a class of exercise at Maggies cenyre each week if any of yous have one nearby it's great they also have nutritional class on  good luck x
Posts.Title: Guys, in a bit of a panic regarding diet - of all things!!!

Posts.Content: Kathleen 37  I have been on exmestane for 2 years now and I have found it so much better still have a bit of joint pain but nothing like I had when on letrozol can't remember which brand will have a check good luck am sure you will find a big difference x
Posts.Title: Been changed from Letrozole (Femera) to Exemestane due to Femera side...

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn not seen you here for some time hope you are keeping well I have often wondered if we need to take vitamin d3 how do you know what symptoms would you have if levels were low x
Posts.Title: vitamin D - who knows their vitamin D levels are low ?

Posts.Content: Been interesting reading all posts about vit.d3 levels it's phaps something I will mention at next appt Carolyn please share your plan when researched ha ha and keep banging the drum I haven't noticed any changes since my oncologist changed my hormone tab I started of in 2014 on tamoxifen then letrosole then exmestane now back on tamoxifen it was changed due mostly to the horrendous flushes day n night dripping also joint pain but hey ho give it another try have a livelo wkend my friends keep well xx
Posts.Title: vitamin D - who knows their vitamin D levels are low ?
